label: TIE Set File Reputation Example
info:
This sample invokes the TIE DXL service to set the enterprise-specific
`trust level` of a file (as identified by hashes). The response to the
TIE request is printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
  [DXL Configuration Sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).
* A TIE service is available on the DXL fabric.
* The DXL client associated with the `Set reputation in TIE` node must have permission to send messages to
  the `/mcafee/service/tie/file/reputation/set` topic, which is part of the
  `TIE Server Set Enterprise Reputation` authorization group.

  The 
  [MAR client authorization documentation](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-client-python/pydoc/marsendauth.html)
  provides an example of authorizing a DXL client to send messages to an
  authorization group. While the example is based on McAfee Active Response
  (MAR), the instructions are the same with the exception of swapping the
  `TIE Server Set Enterprise Reputation` authorization group in place of
  `Active Response Server API`.

### Setup

* Edit the `Specify file hashes` node and modify the `Payload` property with the
  hashes of the file that you want to use for set operation.

  The default hashes used in the JSON-formatted document for this node
  pertain to `notepad.exe`:

  ```json
  {
    "md5": "f2c7bb8acc97f92e987a2d4087d021b1",
    "sha1": "7eb0139d2175739b3ccb0d1110067820be6abd29",
    "sha256": "142e1d688ef0568370c37187fd9f2351d7ddeda574f8bfa9b0fa4ef42db85aa2"
  }
  ```

* Edit the `Specify file name` node and modify the `Set` rule for the
  `msg.fileName` property with the file name that you want to associate with
  the hash values. The `fileName` property is optional, but is useful in
  identifying the particular file that is associated with the hashes (especially
  if the file did not previously exist in the TIE repository).

* To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
  screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
  with the word `connected` should appear under the
  `Set reputation in TIE` node.

### Running

To exercise the flow, double-click the button on the left side of the
`Specify file hashes` node.

### Output

If the set reputation operation succeeds, the following message will be
displayed:

```
Succeeded
```

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Specify file hashes

This is an `inject` input node which starts the flow. This node
injects a new message with a `payload` property which specifies the hashes of
the file to use for the set operation.

#### Specify file name

This is a `change` node which sets the value of the `fileName` property on the
message. The `Set reputation in TIE` node uses the `fileName` property when
constructing the parameters for the TIE file reputation request. 

#### Set hashes request parameter

This is a `change` node which copies the value from the `payload` message
property to the `hashes` property. The `Set reputation in TIE` node uses the
`hashes` property when constructing the parameters for the TIE file
reputation request. 

#### Set reputation in TIE

This is a `tie set file reputation` node. This node connects to the DXL fabric
and sends a DXL `Request` message to the TIE service to set file reputation
information.

The request message includes the `hashes` property set by the
`Set hash request parameters` node and the `fileName` property set by the
`Specify file name` node.

The `Trust level` property is set to "Known trusted" and the
`Comment` property is set to "Reputation set via OpenDXL". The `Comment`
property can be empty but is useful in identifying the particular file which is
associated with the hashes (especially if the file did not previously exist in
the TIE repository).

If the set reputation operation succeeds, the string "Succeeded" is written to
the `payload` property in the output message.

#### Output result

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on
the message by the `Set reputation in TIE` node. If the set reputation operation
succeeded, the text "Succeeded" should be displayed.

name: Supply the file hashes in the 'Specify file hashes' node
Supply the file name in the 'Set file name' node
